When organized in the Roman manner, cavalry was formed into regiments (alce). Each tila, commanded by a prefectus, consisted normally of twelve troops (tumme), each turma of three squads (decuriae) of eleven-i. e., ten men and their commander (decurro). Thus, an dla would contain (12 >< 33) 396 troopers.
